Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.location

Class LocatorFactory

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.location.LocatorFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Dimensioned
public class LocatorFactory extends Object implements Dimensioned
A factory for Locators. Since locators use limited precision coordinates, a same precision must be used to generate comparable locator coordinates.
Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 8 oct. 2020

  • Constructor Details

    • LocatorFactory

      public LocatorFactory​(double precision, Box limits)

      This constructor checks that precision*maxDistance is smaller than Long.MAX_VALUE, to prevent any arithmetic overflow. maxDistance is computed as the diagonal length of the Box passed as argument. Precision is re-adjusted if needed.

      Parameters:
      precision - the precision at which coordinates are truncated (eg 0.001 or 10.0)
      limits - the size of the space this factory is going to work with

  • Method Details

    • convert

      public long convert​(double coord, int dim)

      converts a double coordinate into a long locator coordinate

      Locator coordinates are computed (1) using the lower bound value of the factory limits as the zero for every dimension, and (2) so that a long value of 1 equals the precision on the original coordinate scale.

      Parameters:
      coord - the continuous, double coordinate
      dim - the index of the dimension of the coordinate
      Returns:
      the locator coordinate as long

    • newLocator

      public Locator newLocator​(Point P)
      Converts a point to a locator with given precision (means all coordinates of P are truncated to 1/precision and transformed into longs).
      Parameters:
      P - the point to convert
      Returns:
      the Locator matching P

    • newLocator

      public Locator newLocator​(long... x1)
      instantiate a new locator with long coordinates
      Parameters:
      x1 - coordinate values
      Returns:
      a new Locator instance

      Parameters:

      Returns:
